summary.text:
Describes a field on a model.

Multiple options can be passed to the decorator:
 -

: Whether the field is the primary key of the model,
                 if multiple fields are marked as primary key, their combination will be the key.
 -

: Whether the field has an unique constraint. This will be enforced by the database.
 -

: Whether the field can be null, primary keys cannot be nullable.
 -

: The default value of the field, it can be a value or a function that returns the value.
 -
: The type of the field, it is automatically inferred with typescript.

text.comment:
Describes a field on a model.

Multiple options can be passed to the decorator:

  • primaryKey: Whether the field is the primary key of the model, if multiple fields are marked as primary key, their combination will be the key.
  • unique: Whether the field has an unique constraint. This will be enforced by the database.
  • nullable: Whether the field can be null, primary keys cannot be nullable.
  • default: The default value of the field, it can be a value or a function that returns the value.
  • type: The type of the field, it is automatically inferred with typescript.
Default:
{
  primaryKey: false,
  unique: false,
  nullable: !primaryKey,
}
Example:
class User extends Model {
  @Field({ primaryKey: true })
  id: number
  @Field({ unique: true })
  username: string
  @Field({ default: 0 })
  balance: number
  @Field({ default: () => new Date() })
  createdAt: Date
}
